Description: Pottery wheel-made jug with a handle from the shoulder to the neck. Red-brown Nile silt with common fine white limestone inclusions, mica, and grey-brown inclusions <1mm. White incrustation salts on body.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Mercer Art Gallery, Harrogate. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

3rd to 2nd century BC parallels from Hadra, Alexandria (Enklaar 1998, 23, fig.20). Enklaar, A. 1998. Preliminary report on the pottery found at Hadra station, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 15-24.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.112)
